definition: to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: ‘He’s a gangster involved in organised crime.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个参与帮会犯罪的恶棍。

sentences.english: Because join underworld gang, kelina is thrown into jail to be sentenced 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 因为加入帮会，柯里南身陷囹圄被判刑20年。

sentences.english: The group eventually split into three segments, relegating distinct roles and tasks.
sentences.chinese: 帮会最终分裂成三个阵营，归入不同的任务和角色。

sentences.english: A gang of criminals Gang membership and gang-related crime is primarily a juvenile problem.
sentences.chinese: 帮会和帮派罪行从根本上说是青少年问题。

definition: see 天地會|天地会[Tian1 di4 hui4]
dark road/criminal ways/the underworld/see also 白道[bai2 dao4]
sect/school (group of followers of a particular doctrine)
triad, Chinese crime gang/triad society, anti-Manchu secret society in Qing-dynasty China
bunch of gangsters/criminal gang/organized crime syndicate
late-Qing underground resistance movement against the Qing dynasty
